hackathon-eligibility: If you applied to HackKean III,
hackathon-requirements: Make your project, submit your hack to Devpost and attend the HackKean closing ceremony to show off what you built. You
hackathon-rules: Only teams comprised wholly of eligible participants that submit their hacks to this DevPost, and then go on to demo their hack at the HackKean closing ceremony can win prizes.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: MLH 1st Place Medals & FitBits for each team member
MLH 2nd Place Medals & Echo Dots w/ travel pouches for each team member
MLH 3rd Place Medals & Chromecast for each team member
Philips Hue Lightstrips & Bridges for each team member
Arduino cars for each team member
1 year access of Wolfram Dev Platform/Mathematica & Wolfram|Alpha Pro
1 year of free personal subscription for any single JetBrains tool/IDE
Sketch App licenses for each team member

Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment! Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Members of the winning team receive Hack Harassment Battery Packs!

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=1000 Morris Ave, Union, NJ 07083, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is the hack technically interesting or difficult? Is it just some lipstick on an API, or were there real technical challenges to surmount? This is the most important criterion that your hack will be judged upon for the general prizes.
Is the hack more than just another generic social/mobile/local app? Does it do something entirely novel, or at least take a fresh approach to an old problem?
Is the hack usable in its current state? Is the user experience smooth? Does everything appear to work? Is it well designed?
Is the hack practical? Is it something people would actually use? Does it fulfill a real need people have?

hackathon-description-header: 24 hours of collaboration, prizes, hacking and more
hackathon-location-description: Kean University - North Ave Academic Building
